ygData.subject: RE: [EQ-Monks] Kunark is here! Are lizards better?
ygData.msgSnippet: The Iskare hate EVERYONE, so they won t be friendly to you. Why should they? Both the Good and Evil races have invaded their little island, so I m sure they re
ygData.messageBody:
The Iskare hate EVERYONE, so they won't be friendly to you. Why should they?
Both the Good and Evil races have invaded their little island, so I'm sure
they're going to be pretty upset.

I did a fair amount of the zones lastnight, and the zones are FRIGGIN HUGE.
The poly count has been upped dramatically in all zones, bringing my p2-450
Viper770 256meg machine to a crawl. (The frogloks city in The Swamp comes to
mind).

Make no joke, the hard zones are hard.

Really hard. The castle is insanely difficult. Ook Ook (my guild) but two
solid groups together and got about a quarter of the way in... reminds me of
hate.

The iskar newbie zone, Lake of Ill Omen might be a good place for you to
hunt with your Ogre shaman. I'll be runing down a human cleric and Shadow
Knight twink to asses the difficulty of the new zones.

Stonedorn Windrunner
A Simple Monk of Xegony



-----Original Message-----
From: Thom Green [mailto:thom_mg@...]
Sent: Tuesday, April 25, 2000 2:45 AM
To: EQ-Monks@egroups.com
Subject: Re: [EQ-Monks] Kunark is here! Are lizards better?


I thought that my troll shaman would be a great canadate to take to Kunark,
cause he was evil and worshiped the same god as the monks of the Iskar. Man
was I wrong. The only thing so far I have found in kurnark that are NOT
hostile to my trollie, is the little town in The Overthere, which is a bunch
of evil races in an encapment. If I wasn't a shaman, I couldn't bind there,
and I cant hunt there because everything is blood red, and scowling. I made
my way to the iskar city, with a little luck and help from sow, and found
they are scowling and ready to attack. So I made my way to the good elf
encampent, and guess what? Scowling no less. Does any one know of a race
that the iskar ARE friendly to?

Shelza, Karana
----- Original Message -----
From: Jeffrey Sue
To: EQ-Monks@egroups.com
Sent: Monday, April 24, 2000 2:57 PM
Subject: RE: [EQ-Monks] Kunark is here! Are lizards better?


well being evil is a pain in the ass unless you are willing to work on
factions.
i was just pointing out that being able to kill goodie goodie guards is not
one
of the advantages to being evil, since the goodie goodie races kill goodie
goodie
guards as well. and actually maybe have an easier time of it than evil
races, since they could kill guards til faction drops to apprehensive and
then
do quests to knock it back up again, whereas the evil folks have a hell of
a time doing side quests just so they can get non-kos so they can do the
real
faction quests.

At 11:29 AM 4/24/00 -0500, you wrote:
>Jeffrey Sue writes:
>
> > of course faction doesn't stop druids from killing goodie goodie
> > npc's.
>
>Hell no.
>
>My point was that being evil is NOT the bad thing that a lot make it
>out to be. It's actually quite a good thing in many ways.
>
